intro: Citrullus lanatus var. pulcherrimus, commonly known as the sweet potato, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant produces large, heart-shaped leaves and yellow-orange flowers that are typically pollinated by insects. Its edible tuberous roots are rich in carbohydrates, fiber, and various nutrients. This variety is valued for its versatility in culinary uses and its adaptability to a wide range of growing conditions.
